official-title.#text:
To better integrate engineering education into
		  kindergarten through grade 12 instruction and curriculum and to support
		  research on engineering education.

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Education and the
			 Workforce

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced
			 the following bill; which was referred to the

header.#text:
Amendments to the
			 Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 1111(b) of the Elementary and
			 Secondary Education Act of 1965
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:1111/ss:b

header.#text:
Academic
			 standards, academic assessments, and accountability

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, by adding at the end the
			 following:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:1111/ss:b/p:1

text.#text:
By not
				later than the 2016–2017 school year, each State plan shall demonstrate that
				the State has incorporated engineering design skills and practice into the
				State science challenging academic content standards and student academic
				achievement standards that are required under this
				paragraph.

header.#text:
Integration of
				engineering skills and practices into science standards

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965/s:1111/ss:b/p:3/sp:C/cl:v/scl:II

quote.#text:
(including, beginning not later than the
			 2016–2017 school year, engineering design skills and practices)

, including the integration of engineering concepts into science
			 assessments,

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, shall support, directly or through
			 grants or contracts, research on engineering education, including studies and
			 evaluations that—
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Director
			 of the Institute of Education Sciences

text.#text:
identify and
			 assess how science inquiry and mathematical reasoning can be connected to
			 engineering design in kindergarten through grade 12 curricula and teacher
			 professional development;

identify best
			 practices and promising innovations in the field of kindergarten through grade
			 12 engineering education; and

include any other
			 information or assessments the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall, based on the results of the research described in

, disseminate information and analysis to the public, and provide
			 technical assistance to State educational agencies, on best practices and
			 promising innovations in the field of kindergarten through grade 12 engineering
			 education.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Educating Tomorrow's Engineers Act/s:202/ss:a

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}fund.#text:
such sums as may be necessary for each of fiscal years 2014
			 through 2018
